mods.abstract: Yankee John Henry Stafford (1848-1925) posed seated, holding a cane.

Stafford enlisted in the Union Army at the age of 15 and served the last year of the Civil War as a private, being the youngest member of his company, and one of the few from this county serving in the Union Army. From his service in the Union Army he received the name of "Yankee John". For a number of years following the war he was engaged in farming in which he was successful. In August 1886, he was elected trustee of Jackson County and re-elected in 1888. in 1902, he was elected into the State Senate. In July 1908 he was appointed postmaster and served until 1914. He was a member of the county courts from the First Civil district and a trial lawyer. He was Mayor of Gainesboro two years and had served as deputy sheriff as well.
